Taryn Simon is an artist who uses knowledge and information to create startling and thought-provoking works. Her workshops with approximately 20 internees illuminates the intersections where art, science, poetry and storytelling can create rich reflections on what we think we know about the world in a new light.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor, a depressed young adoptive sister, a neglected cat named Mr. Tweedy, an eccentric, cat-like private investigator, and a ghost who may have committed suicide after murdering his wife... because she acted like a cat. Made for TV.
